basics.name: ELyess Ben Amor
basics.label: Site Reliability Engineer
basics.summary: Born and raised in Tunesia, I studied Infrastructure and Cloud Computing and got my Degree in 2020. My focus has been mainly on knowing cloud infrastructure but also got interested in IoT where I got introduced to DevOps and automation. During my studies I made diffrent projects where I managed Vms, setting up kubernetes cluster and monitoring my workloads. I am very open to learn new technologies as well as meet new experienced people and build knowledge together.

work.name: German Edge Cloud
work.summary: With the cloud and the edge, the German Edge Cloud has two main markets it competes in. In the cloud, German Edge Cloud provides a managed kubernetes offering based on kkp from kubermatic. This in turn utilizes an openstack instance which manages infrastructure over three datacenters which belong to the company. In the edge market, they offer an edge enabling customers to self-service VMs on the edge through a management software developed by the German Edge Cloud. This is for example used by the Fraunhofer Institute to run compute intensive simulations.
highlights: Maintaining multiple rancher instances providing cluster access management to the entire company. For this, rancher was set up and monitored. Additionally, all permission management is done through terraform.
Development of a production readiness review which is used to engage internal teams in a SRE manner.
Engaging internal development teams utilizing the previously outlined production readiness review enabling the teams to increase the reliability of their respective products.
Supporting the company's platform on many clusters and providing observabily.
Managing the operations center, a product used to provision openstack resources through a simplified UI on customer edges working with the openstack CLI to manage customer workloads.
Incident management including PMAs.
Providing a central ArgoCD used across many teams.
Automations using Argo Workflows.

work.name: Aifora GmbH
highlights: Maintaining rancher instance providing cluster access management to the entire company and managing all permission management through terraform.
Lifecycle management of all AWS Instances using Ansible
Monitoring Workload using site24x7 and datadog.
CI/CD pipeline development
Provisioning all kubernetes resources and deploy customer platforms
Perform automation tasks using bash, ansible plugins

work.name: Vorwaerts GmbH
highlights: Gain insights on microservices architectures and devops aspects
Developing Gitlab CI/CD pipelines
Setup Elasticsearch stack to monitor kubernetes pods metrics
